channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0986; 01:13PM; 4600 S 9th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/47DGRLo; Hyde Park; KNOCKDOWN: 26 firefighters extinguished the fire in 13 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was contained to one room. No further details.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E294 E66 E94 RA266 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0986; 01:00PM; 4600 S 9th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/47DGRLo; Hyde Park; One story, single family dwelling with fire in one room. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. ; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E294 E66 E94 RA266 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Outside Fire; INC#0146; 03:37AM; 716 N Sanford Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45AUI3f; #Wilmington; It took thirty firefighters 91 minutes to extinguish the outside fire at an auto dismantling yard, including 7 semi trucks (tractors only, no trailers), and 1 auto. Firefighters protected the nearby business. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E285 E38 E49 E85 RA38 RA85 SO1 T38 T85; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Outside Fire; INC#0146; 02:06AM; 716 N Sanford Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/45AUI3f; #Wilmington; Firefighters are battling a large outside fire involving several semi trucks and at least four additional autos in a dismantling yard.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E285 E38 E49 E85 RA38 RA85 T38 T85; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Flooding; INC#1917; 07:34PM; 11949 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3YI8FKs; #SunValley; Five vehicles stranded in rising waters. Firefighters assisted one person with escaping from their vehicle. Thankfully, no one was injured. This is a good reminder to avoid driving through flooded areas, as you cannot see what is under the surface of the water, and moving water can sweep a vehicle away.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; E289 E290 SW89 T89 T90; CH8; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#1762; 06:34PM; SB 405 Fwy x Burbank Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3amqV4G; #SepulvedaBasin; Firefighters responded to a one-vehicle traffic collision (car vs tree) on the right shoulder of the San Diego Freeway, finding one trapped patient. Firefighters quickly performed extrication measures to free the solo patient from the vehicle. The patient was transported in critical condition to a local trauma center. CHP Log #3779. Nothing further.; FS 88; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 E239 E288 E39 E88 EM17 HR756 RA102 RA99 T39 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Earthquake Mode Complete; INC#1245; 04:00PM; #LosAngeles; Your LAFD completed a strategic 470 square-mile survey of the City of Los Angeles following the 5.1M earthquake near Ojai. No damage or injuries were reported and normal operational mode has resumed. The LAFD reminds residents that, "You can't predict, but you can prepare." Tips and resources for all disasters, not just earthquakes (or tropical storms), are available in a FREE downloadable guide found at https://www.lafd.org/safety/disaster-preparedness; Nicholas Prange

Earthquake Mode; INC#1245; 02:41PM; #LosAngeles; The USGS preliminary report is a magnitude 5.1 earthquake at 2:41 PM PST centered in Ojai, California. The LAFD is now in earthquake mode. All 106 neighborhood fire stations will conduct a strategic survey of their districts, examining all major areas of concern (transportation infrastructures, large places of assemblages, apartment buildings, power-lines, etc). This survey will be conducted from the ground, air and sea. Once this process is complete and reports are consolidated, assuming there is no significant damage, Earthquake mode will be complete. This process typically takes less than one hour. There are currently no initial reports of structural damage or injuries. An update will be provided once earthquake mode is complete.; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 08/20/2023 INC#0279

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0279; 05:03AM; 417 S Colyton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3KNeXCF; #DowntownLA; Firefighters responded to a one-story commercial building with heavy fire inside, threatening an adjacent three-story residential apartment building. Fire crews engaged in a defensive fire fight (from the exterior). Crews ascended ladders to the roof and (defensively) cut strips in the roof (trench cut) to limit the horizontal spread. Firefighters set up heavy streams, including 2.5-inch hand lines, portable monitors, and wagon batteries (deck guns). Ultimately, 98 firefighters skillfully contained the intense fire to only the unit of origin, and extinguished the flames in 47 minutes. No damage was sustained by the adjacent buildings. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E17 E2 E202 E203 E209 E210 E211 E220 E227 E25 E3 E9 EA1 EM1 HR3 PI3 RA17 RA3 RA4 RA803 RA809 SO1 SQ21 T10 T11 T2 T20 T27 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0279; 04:16AM; 840 E 4th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/44fGcwH; #DowntownLA; One-story row of commercials with fire showing from one unit. Defensive mode. ; FS 4; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E17 E2 E202 E209 E210 E211 E227 E25 E3 E9 EM1 HR3 RA3 RA4 RA803 RA809 SO1 SQ21 T10 T11 T2 T27 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Nicholas Prange
